Key Match Events: Australia defeated Afghanistan by 4 runs, scoring 168-8 while Afghanistan scored 164-7.
Rashid Khan's late assault almost led Afghanistan to victory, scoring 48 not out.
Glenn Maxwell scored 54 from 32 balls for Australia.
Naveen-ul-Haq Murid took 3 wickets for 21 runs for Afghanistan.
Fazalhaq Farooqi took 2 wickets for 29 runs for Afghanistan.
Marcus Stoinis, who hit Australia's fastest ever 50 against Sri Lanka last week, scored 25 runs.
David Warner and Mitchell Marsh scored 25 and 45 runs respectively for Australia.
Josh Hazlewood took the important wicket of Mohammad Nabi, who resigned as Afghanistan captain after the game.
Adam Zampa created two catches and contributed to the fall of three wickets in four balls.
Pre-Game Insights: Australia needed to boost their net run rate to advance in the tournament.
Aaron Finch and Tim David were ruled out with hamstring injuries, replaced by Cameron Green and Steve Smith.
Kane Richardson replaced Mitchell Starc among the fast bowlers.
Post-Match Reflections: Australia's fate in the tournament now depends on Sri Lanka beating England.
Mohammad Nabi resigned as Afghanistan captain after the game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Afghanistan needed 71 runs off 42 balls with Gulbadin Naib and Ibrahim Zadran well set before three wickets fell in four balls.
Rashid Khan bowled beautifully and batted aggressively despite a badly jarred knee.
